answers.answer: it sounds like anxiety,i gets all these syptoms and more,try not let the symptoms get you down to much but you do really need to try and see a doctor about this.
I'm not a doctor but it can be one of the following stress related, anxiety,first stage of diabetes,low sugar,low blood pressure or IBS

Sounds like you are dehydrated.  You probably have a vitamin D deficiency.  Optimal level 50-80  We cannot hydrate without minerals but if we have a D deficiency then the calcium doesn't know where to go and just flushes out. If you donot get 30 minutes of sun on 80 percent of your body, 3 times a week without sun screen or eat oily fish every day then you probably have a deficiency. Take 5000iu vitamin D softgels every day for proper D levels. It can take a few months to build up levels but you should start to feel better.  Stay away from soda and caffeine

HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!The symptoms could be due to anemia, diabetes, hypo or hyper thyroid states, overwork, stress and fatigue, high or low BP, pinched cervical spinal nerves, ear problems and hypoglycemia.It is difficult to diagnose on net. May be you can go to a walk in clinic and get this investigated.Hope this helps. Take care!

question: I've been having quite a few problems lately, I have alot of different symptoms such as dizziness, feeling weak, sometimes feeling a bit of vertigo, at times difficult to breathe. I'm not sure what's wrong with me I haven't got to a doctor yet due to no insurance, but it's getting so bad that I'm about to check myself into a hospital. Does anyone have any ideas on what I may have?
title: Multiple symptoms
